author: Andrew Jeong
title: South Korea Says U.S. Has Indicated It Is Open to Talks With North
text:
SEOUL—The U.S. views recent talks between the two Koreas in a positive light and has indicated through multiple channels that it could seek talks with the North, South Korea’s leader said, in another signal that Washington may be considering changes to its policy of talking to Pyongyang only if the North commits to denuclearization.

President Moon Jae-in made the comments during a summit on Tuesday with his Latvian counterpart in Seoul. The presidential Blue House said Mr. Moon had come to that conclusion through “multiple...
